page.title: 16HUTTON MARR SCHOOL
page.content: The original school building shell can still be visited, lying beside a footpath running West from the Penrith road, at a point some 1.5km South of Hutton End. Records indicate that the original school was provided by Trustees in the early Eighteenth Century, before the Church School movement took place. The present school building, at Hutton End, was constructed, under the provisions ofthe Trustees' successors, early in this Century. The school and playing fields, together with the use of the village hall adjoining, have been the beginning of wide horizons for very many children for very many generations. As this Domesday Survey is being conducted, the final closure of the school has been fixed for 1985.
